removals.reasoning: The outer parentheses around the cast are redundant. The cast itself must keep parentheses, but wrapping that in another pair is unnecessary in a function argument.
Same as above: redundant outer parentheses around a cast in a function call.
Redundant outer parentheses around the cast; keep the cast but remove the extra grouping for readability.
A is already a uint8_t*; free accepts a void*, so the cast (and all surrounding parentheses) is unnecessary. Using free(A) is clearer and equivalent.
Parentheses around the array index expression are unnecessary; A[i * n + j] is equivalent and clearer.
The outer parentheses around the division are unnecessary. Also the cast syntax is better written as (double)n rather than (double)(n).
Parentheses around the operand of the cast are redundant; the cast (double)n already applies to the whole expression.

Inner parentheses around the subexpression are unnecessary when the whole numerator is already parenthesized. (num + factor - 1) / factor is clearer; removing the inner parentheses does not change precedence.
Parentheses around the array index are unnecessary; A[j * n + j] is equivalent and clearer.
Same as line 178: remove redundant parentheses around the index expression.
Parentheses around the array index are unnecessary; use A[i * n + j].
Parentheses around the array index are unnecessary; use A[j * n + j].

removals.replacement: A[i * n + j] / A[j * n + j]
removals.reasoning: The outer parentheses around the division are unnecessary. After removing the index parentheses (above), the division can be written directly.
Parentheses around this simple comparison are redundant in an assignment to a boolean-like variable; dropping them keeps the condition clear.
Redundant parentheses around a simple comparison; removing them improves readability.
Redundant parentheses around a simple comparison; keep the bare comparison expression.
Unnecessary grouping around the comparison; it can be assigned directly.
Parentheses around this comparison are not needed for correct precedence or clarity.
Parentheses around the arithmetic index expression are redundant; use the plain expression in the assignment.
Same as line 207: parentheses around the arithmetic expression are unnecessary.
Remove redundant parentheses around the index arithmetic expression.
Parentheses in the array index are unnecessary; A[i * n + k] is clearer.
The outer parentheses are redundant around the cast of an address. Writing (uint8_t*)&dim_temp_a_coerce is idiomatic and equivalent.
Same pattern as previous argument: remove the extra parentheses around the casted address.
Remove redundant outer parentheses around the cast of the address; (uint8_t*)&... is sufficient.
Same as above: outer parentheses around the cast are unnecessary.
Redundant outer parentheses around a casted address; simplify to (uint8_t*)&block_copy.
Remove unnecessary extra parentheses around the cast of &block.
Outer parentheses around the cast are redundant; use the direct cast of the address.
Simplify the casted address expression by removing the extra parentheses.
Remove redundant grouping around the cast; the cast syntax already conveys intent.
Same as above: extra parentheses around a casted address are unnecessary.
Outer parentheses around the cast are redundant; writing (uint8_t*)&grid_copy_coerce is clearer.
Remove the extra parentheses around the casted address expression for readability.
Parentheses around a single identifier passed as an argument are unnecessary; remove them to improve clarity.
Index expression grouping is unnecessary; use A[i * n + j] for readability and consistency with other index usages.
Parentheses around a single identifier argument are redundant; remove them for clarity.
